name: Spider-Man: The Other Online Trivia | Spider-Man | 15 Questions

questions.text: Who is the new villain seen robbing a bank?
questions.explanation:
Tracer.

	Tracer is a evildoer who claims to command machines, and shot Spider-Man in the shoulder with homing bullets. He also was intent on attacking Aunt May in Stark Tower.

questions.text: After being shot, Spider-Man sees a doctor recommended to him by which other hero?
questions.explanation:
Captain America.

	Doctor Castillo runs some obligatory blood tests on Peter, and finds out that he is suffering from a terminal illness. Spidey gets second opinions, but they are all the same diagnosis.

questions.text: Iron Man attacks Spider-Man when someone begins controlling the Iron Man armor.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Tony Stark is an ultra-rich inventor who has provided a roof over the Avengers' heads for many years. Tracer takes control of his armor and makes Iron Man attack his ally.

questions.text: Mary Jane sees that Spider-Man is getting sloppy in battle. What is her theory?
options: Spidey is getting too old for heroics
questions.explanation:
Spidey has a death wish.

	Who would have ever thought that the science geek would marry the future model and actress? Mary Jane hypothesizes that her husband has a death wish, but Peter then shows her Doctor Castillo's findings.

questions.text: What name does Tracer use while talking to Aunt May?
questions.explanation:
Tommy.

	Tracer claims to be a god created by machines, much like the way humans created gods to worship. Not knowing he is a villain, Aunt May makes him a peanut butter sandwich.

questions.text: Which superhero is not consulted in Peter's search to find a cure?
questions.explanation:
Daredevil.

	No matter which expert he turns to, Peter Parker cannot find any treatment or cure for his rapidly-deteriorating health. While Daredevil makes an appearance in the story arc, he is not consulted about Spidey's illness.

questions.text: Which villain does Peter mercilessly beat, thinking him to be Morlun?
questions.explanation:
The Ox.

	The Ox is a very strong street thug who has proved to be a minor menace to Spider-Man on several occasions. Despite his failing health, Spider-Man is still able to beat him, and loses control when he hallucinates and thinks The Ox is actually Morlun.

questions.text: Where do Aunt May, Mary Jane and Peter Parker go to travel back in time?
questions.explanation:
Latveria.

	Latveria is ruled by the despotic Victor Von Doom, primarily a foe of the Fantastic Four. Being an evil scientific genius, Doctor Doom obviously has a few time machines just laying around his castle!

questions.text: Where does Spidey take his wife on vacation?
questions.explanation:
Outer Space.

	Peter and Mary Jane use one of Tony Stark's space pod to look down on the Earth after having dinner in Paris. Peter briefly considers using his spider-sense to win big in Las Vegas, but rejects the idea.

questions.correct: He tears out Spider-Man's left eye
options: He rips Spider-Man's face to shreds
He tears out Spider-Man's right eye
questions.explanation:
He tears out Spider-Man's left eye.

	Morlun plucks out Spider-Man's left eye and eats it, feeding off Spidey's life force. He then severely pummels Spider-Man, leaving him in critical condition.

questions.text: Morlun seeks to finally kill Spider-Man when the incapacitated hero is in the hospital. Who comes to Spidey's aid?
questions.explanation:
Mary Jane.

	Mary Jane tries to defend her husband by attacking Morlun with a scalpel. Her efforts are for naught, as Morlun easily defeats her and breaks her arm.

Spider-Man.

	In a last surge of strength, Spider-Man transforms into a true spider/man hybrid and attacks Morlun, ripping his throat open. His energy depleted, Spider-Man dies in his wife's arms immediately thereafter.

questions.text: Luke Cage flirts with Mary Jane following Peter's death.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Wolverine commits that ugly deed, not Luke Cage. Wolverine had no real intention of dating Mary Jane, but felt she needed someone or something to lash out at.

questions.text: Who escapes from the room which holds Spider-Man's body?
questions.explanation:
Spider-Man.

	Like a snake, Spider-Man has shed his skin and left it behind, jumping out of the window to rest and complete his transformation. He hangs in a cocoon under the Brooklyn Bridge.

questions.text: What does Peter remove from his old body?
questions.explanation:
His wedding ring.

	After returning to Stark Tower and his wife and Aunt May, Peter Parker spends a night with his wife and leaves bed briefly to get his wedding ring as he contemplates his transformation.
